intro: Drimia chalumnensis, commonly known as the Chalumne lily, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots and linear, grass-like leaves. The plant produces striking, showy flowers that are typically white or pale pink, arranged in umbels. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its ornamental value and unique floral structure, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts.
